chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery Carmona was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

miscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations, including aftercare programming.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief

Court Reporter Carolyn Kingsley. Defendant Jeffery Carmona in court with attorney Frank Earl Arnett.  Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State - additions to PSI - no 950 requirement.
Defense - 1 correction to PSI - dob of son Jeff Jr. is 2014.

BTC:  on 15CF1560 - count 1 - $200 fine and court costs, including DNA assessment.  60 days to pay, serve 2 months RCJ for non-payment. 
On count 3 - withheld sentence - 2 years probation.  No alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by doctor, random UA's.  AODO treatment, aftercare or other counseling deemed appropriate by agent.  Maintain full time verifiable employment.

On CF184 - count 1 - withheld sentence -  2 years probation.  Same conditions.  Concurrent to 1560.  Serve 6 months RCJ - STAYED, to be used at agent's discretion.  Eligible for CIP and substance abuse trement.  DNA sample.  Firearms/voting warnings given.  Costs including DNA surcharge on both charges.  CFTS if revoked.

Sentencing hearing on August 11, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Jeffery Carmona in court with attorney Frank Earl Arnett.  Defendant Jeffery Carmona in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Offer:  In 15CF1560, Plea to Ct. 1, rec $100 fine+cc, Ct. 3, probation. In 16CF184, plea to Ct. 1, rec 6 mo RCJ.

Plea:

16CF184:  Ct. 1 - NC.

Cts. 1&3 - GUILTY.  Ct. 2 - DRI.

Ct. 1 - GUILTY.  Ct. 2 - DRI.
PSI ordered.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Ct 1: 343.44(1)(b)-OAR; Ct 2: 961.41(3g)(b)-PCS; Ct 3: 961.41(3g)(e)-PCS/THC 2nd & subsequent. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Plea hearing on June 7, 2016 at 09:30 am.
